sentence.Network_en: He was now to be seen legging it across the field.
sentence.Network_cn: 现在可以看到他快步跑过田地。

sentence.Network_en: Leg warmers are pass é , but hybrid legging - leg warmers from Chanel totally rock.
sentence.Network_cn: 暖腿套早已成为过去式, 然而香奈儿的保暖长袜绝对让你惹火至极.

entry.def: A person or animal's legs are the long parts of their body that they use to stand on.

example.ex: He was tapping his walking stick against his leg.

entry.def: The legs of a pair of trousers are the parts that cover your legs.

example.ex: He moved on through wet grass that soaked his trouser legs.
example.tran: 他继续前行，穿过湿漉漉的草地，裤腿全湿透了。

entry.def: A leg of lamb, pork, chicken, or other meat is a piece of meat that consists of the animal's or bird's leg, especially the thigh.
The legs of a table, chair, or other piece of furniture are the parts that rest on the floor and support the furniture's weight.

example.ex: His ankles were tied to the legs of the chair...
example.tran: 他的脚脖子被绑在椅腿上。

example.ex: The teak table has fluted legs.
example.tran: 这张柚木桌子的桌腿有凹槽纹饰。

entry.def: A leg of a long journey is one part of it, usually between two points where you stop.

example.ex: The first leg of the journey was by boat to Lake Naivasha in Kenya.
example.tran: 行程的首段是乘船到肯尼亚的奈瓦沙湖。

entry.def: A leg of a sports competition is one of a series of games that are played to find an overall winner.

example.ex: The first round of the cup was decided over two legs...
example.tran: 杯赛的首轮以两场分胜负。

example.ex: They will televise both legs of Leeds' European Cup clash with Rangers.
example.tran: 欧洲杯利兹联队与流浪者队的两场争夺战都将进行电视转播。

entry.def: If you leg it, you run very quickly, usually in order to escape from someone.

example.ex: We saw some kids shinning up a drainpipe before legging it clutching a TV and hi-fi...
example.tran: 我们看见几个年轻人爬上了排水管，后来就见他们提着一台电视机和音响跑掉了。

example.ex: He was now to be seen legging it across the field.
example.tran: 现在可以看到他快步跑过田地。

entry.def: If you say that something or someone is on their last legs, you mean that the period of time when they were successful or strong is ending.

example.ex: This relationship is on its last legs.
example.tran: 这段关系已经快玩儿完了。

entry.def: If you are pulling someone's leg, you are teasing them by telling them something shocking or worrying as a joke.

example.ex: Of course I won't tell them; I was only pulling your leg.
example.tran: 我当然不会告诉他们啦。我跟你开玩笑的。

entry.tran: 能够证实/无法证实；站得住脚/站不住脚
entry.def: If you say that someone does not have a leg to stand on, or hasn't got a leg to stand on, you mean that a statement or claim they have made cannot be justified or proved.

example.ex: It's only my word against his, I know. So I don't have a leg to stand on.
example.tran: 现在是我和他各说各的，这我知道。所以我的话无法证实。

entry.def: If an idea, plan, or activity has legs, it is likely to continue or succeed.

example.ex: The American economy still has legs.
example.tran: 美国经济仍可持续发展。

means.word_mean: 1. a garment covering the leg (usually extending from the knee to the ankle)

auth_sentence.content: The players were lined up behind home plate and taking turns running to second, legging out would-be doubles.
auth_sentence.res_content: The players were lined up behind home plate and taking turns running to second, legging out would-be doubles.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The players were lined up behind home plate and taking turns running to second, legging out would-be doubles.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表名词,"状态物品,行业等"; 2. 表介词,"在……情况下……"; 3. 表形容词,"正……的或令人……的"; 4. "……的"

stems_affixes.word_buile: advertise做广告+ing行业→n.广告业;广告活动 adj.广告的;广告业务的
assume假装,假定+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.傲慢的,不逊的,僭越的
change变化+ing正……的或令人……的→正在变化的
correspond通信;符合+ing……的→adj.相应的,通讯的
discriminate辨别,歧视+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.有辨别能力的
encourage鼓励+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.鼓舞人心的
endure持久,持续+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.持久的,不朽的
engross吸引+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.引人入胜的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 非常的,极度的,胜过的,过度的

exhilarate使高兴+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.使人兴奋的
fascinate使……入迷+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.迷人的,吸引人的

hard艰难+work工作+ing……的→adj.苦干的,不辞辛劳的
increase增加+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.日益增加的,增大的
inspire鼓舞+ing令人……的→inspiring灌输的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有趣味的,令人好奇[或注意]的
stems_affixes.word_buile: interest使发生兴趣,引起……的注意+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.有趣味的,令人好奇[或注意]的

out出+go走+ing正……的或令人……的→走出来→心胸宽→待人友善的
precede先于+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.在前的,前述的
promise允许,答应+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.有希望的,有前途的
refresh使清新+ing令人……的→adj.使心神爽快的
rivet铆钉,固定+ing正……的或令人……的→如铆钉一样把人钉[吸引]住→非常精彩的
threaten恐吓,威胁+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.胁迫的,危险的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 欠缺的,没有的,不够格的
